snippet: Amid crippling drought, many California communities are fighting not the cultivation of marijuana plants — which is legal, though subject to restrictions — but the growers’ use of water.
abstract: Many California communities, stricken by crippling drought, are fighting back against water theft by marijuana growers; while cannabis cultivation is legal in California, marijuana is an extremely thirsty plant, and growers have begun siphoning off extra supplies in order to maintain their product.
lead_paragraph: Amid crippling drought, many California communities are fighting not the cultivation of marijuana plants — which is legal, though subject to restrictions — but the growers’ use of water.

headline.main: Dry California Fights Illegal Use of Water for Cannabis
